qas.question: Who is responsible for the organization and development of Montevideo's transport infrastructure?
Where is the Tres Cruces Bus Terminal located?

answers.text: the lower level of the Tres Cruces Shopping Center

context: The <a0_0><a1_0>Dirección Nacional de Transporte<a1_0/><a0_0/> (DNT), part of the national Ministry of Transport and Public Works, is responsible for the organization and development of Montevideo's transport infrastructure. A bus service network covers the entire city. An international bus station, the Tres Cruces Bus Terminal, is located on <a2_0>the lower level of the Tres Cruces Shopping Center<a2_0/>, on the side of Artigas Boulevard. This terminal, along with the Baltazar Brum Bus Terminal (or Rio Branco Terminal) by the Port of Montevideo, handles the long distance and intercity bus routes connecting to destinations within Uruguay.
